item.title: 4 killed as dump truck collides with autovans in Naogaon
item.description: Four people have been killed after a dump truck struck two battery-powered autovans carrying vegetables in Naogaon. The crash happened early on Saturday at the Patkathi junction on the Naogaon–Patnitala road in Mohadevpur Upazila, according to Naogaon Superintendent of Police Tarikul Islam.

item.title: US approves potential $9 billion sale of Patriot missiles to Saudi Arabia
item.description: The US State Department has approved the potential sale of Patriot interceptor missiles and related equipment to Saudi Arabia for an estimated cost of $9 billion, the Pentagon said on Friday. The principal contractor for the sale of the missiles - Patriot advanced capability-3 missile segment enha

item.title: Digitisation, inter-agency coop lapses slow investment proposal execution
item.description: Persistent implementation gaps in digitisation and inter-agency coordination continue to undermine trade efficiency and investment execution, belying progress in necessary reforms, officials said Friday about latest findings. A high-level government body in a meeting Thursday noted such drawbacks

item.title: 23 jute mills in Khulna to suspend production from Sunday
item.description: Production at 23 private jute mills in the Khulna region will be suspended from Sunday due to an acute shortage of raw jute. The crisis was created after excessive rainfall disrupted jute cultivation in Shariatpur, Madaripur and Gopalganj, resulting in lower-than-expected output, jute mill owners

item.title: Expatriates send nearly 140,000 postal ballots home
item.description: Expatriates registered through the “Postal Vote BD” app to cast their votes in the 13th Jatiya Sangsad (JS) election and the referendum have begun sending back their ballots. So far, 139,763 expatriate ballots have arrived in the country, said Salim Ahmad Khan, team leader of the OCV-S

item.title: Work stoppage over NCT foreign deal halts Ctg port operations
item.description: Chittagong Port workers and employees have launched a work stoppage to protest the decision to appoint foreign companies to operate the New Mooring Container Terminal (NCT). The operations at the Chittagong Port have come to a halt following the enforcement of the protest by the port unit of the J

item.title: Murder case filed over Jamaat leader's death in Sherpur clash
item.description: A murder case has been filed two days after the death of a Jamaat-e-Islami leader during clashes between supporters of rival political parties in Sherpur. More than 700 people have been named as accused in the case, including a BNP candidate contesting the Sherpur-3 parliamentary seat. Police sai

item.title: Central Insurance holds Annual Managers’ Conference 2025
item.description: Central Insurance PLC has recently organised its Annual Managers’ Conference 2025 at the Samson H Chowdhury Hall of Dhaka Club Ltd, according to a press release Saturday. The company's Chairman Mohammed Masud Hossain attended the event as the chief guest, with Vice Chairman Mohammed Masud Ka

item.title: Gold records sharpest one-day fall, down Tk 15,746 per bhori
item.description: Gold prices in the Bangladesh market fell sharply again, with the price of 22-carat gold dropping by Tk 15,746 per bhori (11.664 grams) in a single day, the Bangladesh Jewellers Association (Bajus) announced on Saturday. In a morning notification, Bajus said the new price of 22-carat gold has been

item.title: Hajj visa applications to open from February 8
item.description: The Religious Affairs Ministry has announced that applications for Hajj visas for the current year will open on February 8 and continue until March 20. The ministry issued a notice in this regard on Thursday. All registered Hajj pilgrims, both through government and private channels, are currentl

item.title: 12 names removed from ‘July fighters’ gazette
item.description: The government has removed the names of 12 people who were earlier enlisted in the July fighters gazette. The Ministry of Liberation War Affairs recently issued a notification cancelling the previous gazette. The notification said the cancellation was made under the authority granted by Section 1

item.title: Swechchhasebak Dal leader killed in ‘BNP factional clash’ in Narayanganj
item.description: A leader of Swechchhasebak Dal has been killed in a clash allegedly between two BNP faction at Trishkania in Kanchan municipality area in Rupganj upazila. The deceased was identified as Azhar Uddin, 48, senior vice-president of the Swechchhasebak Dal’s Ward No. 9 unit. Three others&md
